javanews.gui.internalframe
Class COMPortClient

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JInternalFrame
                  javanews.gui.internalframe.COMPortClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
public class COMPortClient
extends javax.swing.JInternalFrame

Represents and displays a monitoring thread for a specific COM port given a set of compatible parameters. This class is responsible for monitoring a given COM port specified by the user. The window displays those messages received from that COM port that can be understood and interpreted as vaild PSE messages. The window also lists PSEs and their configured links that have been entered into the database with supporting information. The window can also recognise those PSEs and links that have not been entered or acknowledged by the user and lists these seperately for acknowledgement and further action from the user.

This class forms the backbone of the rest of the application with many of the other classes being called through interactions with this window.

Version:
1.000
Author:
Alex Harris (email: Alexander.J.Harris(at)btinternet.com)
See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

COMPortClient

public COMPortClient(java.lang.String comPortName,
                     int baud,
                     int data,
                     java.lang.String parity,
                     float stop)
Intialises the class, internal logger and set the parameters for the COM port connection.

Parameters:
comPortName - The identifying name of the COM port
baud - The requested baud rate for the COM port
data - The length of the data in bits
parity - The parity type to be used for error correction
stop - The length of the stop bits

private javax.swing.JTree buildReportTree()
Builds the tree used to contain entries allowing the user to run reports between certain dates or for PSEs or specific links on a PSE.

Returns:
The JTree to be placed in the window

buildAlarmTable

private javax.swing.JTable buildAlarmTable()
Builds the table used to display received alarms.

Returns:
The table to be used for displaying alarms ready to be placed in the window

buildLinkTable

private javax.swing.JTable buildLinkTable()
Retrieves the data from the database about links known to the system. On initial launch all of the links will be shown with a link state of unknown until the application receives an explicit LINK UP or LINK DOWN message from a link. At this point the state will be updated until further UP or DOWN messages are received.

Returns:
The known links in a table for display in the window

buildNewLinks

private javax.swing.JTable buildNewLinks()
Builds a blank table for newly discovered links to be added. As they are discovered by the application they are added with a link state if a LINK UP or LINK DOWN message is received.

Returns:
The discovered links in a table for display in the window.

getReportTree

public javax.swing.JTree getReportTree()
Returns the instance of JTree used by the user to select reports either by date/time or by PSE/link.

Returns:
The tree used for report generation
See Also:
JTree

getAlarmTable

public javax.swing.JTable getAlarmTable()
Returns the instance of JTable used to display alarms to the user.

Returns:
The table used to hold received alarms
See Also:
JTable

getLinkTable

public javax.swing.JTable getLinkTable()
Returns the instance of JTable used to display recognised links. Recognised links are those stored within the back-end database in persistent storage.

Returns:
The table used to hold existing links
See Also:
JTable

getNewLinkTable

public javax.swing.JTable getNewLinkTable()
Returns the instance of JTable used to display discovered links. Discovered links are those stored in memory and will be lost on application shut-down unless acknowledge by the user and thus moved into the back-end database and "existing links".

Returns:
The table used to hold discovered links
See Also:
JTable

turnStatusOn

public void turnStatusOn()
Changes the status light in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen to the illuminated (on) icon. This should be done while the application receives data and is processing it until the point that data is stored in the database.

turnStatusOff

public void turnStatusOff()
Changes the status light in the bottom right-hand corner of the screen to the unilluminated (off) icon. This is the default status for the icon.

Parameters:
rdwNew - The instance of RawDataWindow to be displayed

RawDataWindow

removeRawDataWindow

public void removeRawDataWindow()
Removes an instance of RawDataWindow from the class. This should be called from the windowClosing() event as the window closes.

To be used with isRawDataWindowOpen() to determine whether an instance is being used and return it if necessary.

Returns:
The instance of RawDataWindow attached to this thread.

RawDataWindow

isRawDataWindowOpen

public boolean isRawDataWindowOpen()
Indicates whether there is an instance of RawDataWindow currently attached to this class. This can be used in conjunction with other methods to manipulate the presence of a window displaying raw data.

Returns:
Whether there is a window open displaying raw data from the COM port

stopThread

public void stopThread()
Stops the current thread from executing and receiving any further messages on the COM port.

addAlarmData

public void addAlarmData(java.lang.Object[] newRow)
Adds a new row to the alarm table within the window. The supplied array must be composed as follows:
  • [0] Message severity
  • [1] PSE which generated the message
  • [2] Originating link
  • [3] Error message which was generated
  • [4] Date when the message was generated (according to the PSE)
  • [5] The Universally Unique Identifier of the message

Parameters:
newRow - The new row to be added to the table containing the columns mentioned above.

setLinkData

public void setLinkData(java.lang.Object[] newRowData)
Sets the state of an existing link. The supplied array must be composed as follows:
  • [0] PSE Name
  • [1] Link ID on the named PSE
  • [2] Status of the link, where:
    • 0 - Link Down
    • 1 - Link Up
    • 2 - Default state, unknown

Parameters:
newRowData - The new row to be added to the table containing the columns mentioned above.

addNewLink

public void addNewLink(java.lang.String pse,
                       java.lang.String linkID,
                       int state)
Adds a newly discovered link to the discovered link table along with its current state.

Parameters:
pse - The name of the PSE the link is attached to
linkID - The link ID that has been discovered
state - The state of the link:
  • 0 - Link Down
  • 1 - Link Up
  • 2 - Default state, unknown

                           LinkChart lcWindow)

migrateLink

public void migrateLink(java.lang.String discoveredId,
                        java.lang.String recognisedId)
Migrates the named link from the discovered link table to the recognised table.

Parameters:
discoveredId - The ID of the link within the tblNewLinks table
recognisedId - The ID of the link within the tblCodexLinks table

removeDiscoveredLink

public java.lang.Integer removeDiscoveredLink(java.lang.String discoveredLinkId)
Removes the specified link from the new links table within the database and from the GUI.

Parameters:
discoveredLinkId - The universally unique identifier of the discovered link to be removed from the database.
Returns:
The state of the link when it was removed. -1 if it wasn't found.

addRecognisedLink

public void addRecognisedLink(java.lang.String pseName,
                              java.lang.String linkID,
                              java.lang.Integer state)
Adds a new recognised PSE to the GUI. It forces the link table and report tree to be refreshed with the new link but does not save the data in the database

Parameters:
pseName - The name of the PSE
linkID - The link ID
state - The current state of the link
